title: Finding the Foci with c
text: Since we know that $$a=10$$ and $$b=2$$, we can solve for c using the equation $$c=\sqrt{a^2-b^2}$$, which gives us $$c=\sqrt{96}$$. Since this is a horizontal ellipse, the foci are (-1-sqrt(96),2),(-1+sqrt(96),2)
speech: Since we know that  a is equal to 10  and  b, is equal to 2 , we can solve for c using the equation  c, is equal to the square root of a squared minus b squared end root , which gives us  c is equal to, the square root of 96 . Since this is a horizontal ellipse, the foci are (-1-sqrt(96),2),(-1+sqrt(96),2)
